alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:31AM CDT until May 19 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria County. For the Guadalupe River...including Victoria, Bloomington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River At Victoria. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Water crosses Fordyce Road at the large culvert between the lakes. The main portion of Saxet Lake Park is closed and water covers some of the picnic areas and roads. Gates located at the intersection of Fordyce Road and Fox road, as well as the intersection of Fordyce Road and Timber Drive are closed and no traffic is allowed through. Water is under the U. S. Business 59 East and West relief bridges, and over Criag and Constitution. Areas west of Moody Street between Water and Constituion are threatened. At 29.5 feet, Major lowland flooding occurs. Riverside Park, much of the golf course, including the golf cart sheds, and the zoo flood. Water begins to flow over the river bank in the Greens Addition Subdivision at the end of Gunther Street, and begins to encrouch into the roadway ditches. The homes in the Greens Addition Subdivision may be impacted by shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 27.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to rise to a crest of 29.2 feet Tuesday morning. It is expected to then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Guadalupe River Victoria 21.0 27.6 Sun 8 am 28.8 29.2 28.5 24.6 18.0 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.
